title: So star guardian lux is getting a small VU
body: What's the excuse for pulse fire ez not getting one?

replies.body:
...I fucking called this when I read the title.  I went in despite knowing that this is the question that would be asked. I must be a god damn masochist. 

Do you see any other pulsefire champion skins being released?  No?  Notice how we're getting 4 new Star Guardian skins?  **That's why.**
Also, it's not a Vu. She's getting a minor texture update, and a new homguards animation that matches the other skins. That's it.

Yup, this is pretty much it! We felt she's be left out, especially since we have a team comp with these skins. It was due to the other group of SG skins being released. If we didn't release other SG skins, we wouldn't have touched SG Lux.

{{champion:78}}: Uhhh...HAMMER!

Poppy is definitely viable as a jungler, she posts up pretty decent numbers in the role.

The AA reset was removed because it compressed her damage window.  Burst is not supposed to be a big strength of her, so the fact that she would get Ex2, Q1, Q2, passive + Auto more or less for free when she got the jump on someone was deemed an inappropriate strength.  Of all the things in that combo, the one that made the least sense was the random AA reset after the ranged basic attack, so we removed it.

Texture Updates are different from a Full VU.  The skins like Star Guardian Lux and Dragon Trainer Lulu were touched up in their textures: slightly changing colors, altering little designs within the clothes, ect.  Same with the adding of unique axe catch emblems for other Draven skins.  They are tiny detail changes to bring up the quality to the standard of the other skins.

A VU would be them actually building a full new model, animations, ect for the champion/skin  (aka starting over from scratch)
SG Lux got a texture update, and a new homeguard animation to match the new Star Guardian skins.
